poem:
Title: "A New Dawn in the Cabinet"

Cameron like a Saxon king returned,
From quiet haunts to the whirl of Cabinet affair.
Securing justice, with a steadfast stare,
Where Johnson and Raab merely spurned.
In corridors of power, the tide has turned,
"Prime Minister for the External, fair."
Resounds the whisper in the diplomatic air,
'A change has come,' the bureaucrats discerned.
